reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were very pleased with this hotel. The room was spotless and a good size, the breakfast very good (especially that Nespresso machine), and location very convenient (a metro stop right out the door, and walkable to so much) and the staff very helpful (general questions, restaurant reservations, etc).
reviews.title: Very nice hotel at very good price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011
reviews.text: For the quality, and I thought this hotel was very reasonable. There are many nice restaurants nearby as well. We mostly walked but did resort to the metro and cable car on occasion. Lisbon is a VERY hilly city, and the cobblestones can be tough on the feet, so sometimes you do need a break.
reviews.title: Excellent location and value!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled solo
reviews.text: We really liked the city, and thought this hotel was just perfect.
reviews.title: Extremely Welcoming

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excellent choice in lisbon! Breakfast was not very good but really excellent compared to cost in general! Will stay there next time as well!
reviews.title: Great choice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled solo
reviews.text: Norway
reviews.title: Good place to crash and view the city

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for one night and were very impressed. We arrived at 1100 and were able to get into our room straight away without even asking for early check in. The room was average size and was modern and very clean. The hotel is well located - you can walk to downtown Lisbon in 15-20 mins and there is a metro stop right outside and buses/taxis nearby. The hotel staff were very helpful and dealt with all our queries efficiently. The price we paid included an excellent buffet breakfast. Overall would highly recommend this hotel for a stay in Lisbon- cannot think of anything negative to comment on.
reviews.title: Good hotel with very helpful staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for 2 days pre cruise arriving mid morning on a Saturday but they were able to give us immediately the room we had booked. The hotel 's photographs imply larger rooms than reality but space was still more than adequate. The breakfast buffet was comprehensive with good range of fresh fruits, cereals, cold cheese & ham selection plus the standard hot dishes of scrambled eggs/bacon/sausage/mushrooms/tomatoes etc. The hotel is located on a street corner (very little outside noise) about a 15 minute downhill stroll to the shopping/commercial/bus interchange centre of Lisbon but with the very good public transport or cheap taxis easy for the return. All the staff we encountered were polite, efficient, friendly trying to anticipate our needs eg calling the lift or opening main entrance doors without being over pompous. The hotel was chosen from previous TA reviews and it exceeded expectations.
reviews.title: Excellent staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Just returned from a 5 night stay, could not fault Marques de Pombal in any way. Hotel is very clean, staff are extremely friendly and helpful, rooms are of a good size, bathrooms are well equipped,hotel is in a good location, metro is immediately outside the front door and connects with all other modes of transport. Breakfast buffet is varied and the bread and sweet rolls are wonderful. If anything runs out it is immediately replaced. In our opinion we could not have picked a better hotel. Staff recommended a restaurant at the new revamped dock area for our last night, called Oceanos, the fish was to die for, the cab fare for 4 of us was 4.50 euro's and the bill was not overpriced, but you would need to get reception to make a reservation as it was full the night we were there. Lisbon is a lovely city with a very spacious feel to it, until you get into Alfama and it's winding narrow streets !!, don't miss Tram 28, but as previously mentioned get the 737 bus to the castle as it is a considerable climb to the top from Tram 28, Use tram 28 for the fun ! and sights. Buy a 3 day transport ticket exceptional value as it covers all forms of transport. Don't miss Belem and the Jeronimos Monastery, Monument to the Discoveries, and Belem Tower.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel and staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Have coffee and custard tarts at Cafe Brasileira, in Chiado,best in town.
reviews.title: great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all a very good few days and if we ever go back to Lisbon would stay at Marques de Pombal again
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel and Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010
reviews.text: I stayed in this hotel whilst residential week at university, great customer service, perfect location, easy access to public transport, nice modern design and good food
reviews.title: One of the best hotels i stayed in!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: This hotel is nice and clean and the staff are friendly. All the rooms are decorated in their own unique style and have an ensuite/bath with towels provided. Breakfast included a range of continental style & cooked food as well as usual pastries and fruit. There was even tea!
reviews.title: Pretty nice hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel has great location, with a metro stop just outside the hotel. If you fancy a longer stroll down the treelined avenue to mainline station it is only 10 minutes away. The tourist office next to the mainline station is also a good way and often cheaper to book tours. We did a day's tour to fatima, batalha, alcobaca, obidos & nazare for 60 euros, with cool tour lx & got picked up/dropped off outside our hotel. Our guide Pedro was a good laugh!
reviews.title: A gem of a hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: Beside doing all the normal sightseeing we took the train to Sintra for 1 day and toured the Pena Palace and the Moorish Castle. Your ticket is valid 2 days and Moorish Castle is a steep climb, so we came back and Pena the following day.
reviews.title: A modern business hotel that exceeded my expectations.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: L' Olive Restaurant is round the corner from the hotel and is great for eatling out late as the Portuguese do. Ambience is brilliant and the food is very nicely presented and tastes great.
reviews.title: Cannot fault this hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: I've picked this hotel for our New Year's trip. It was a great choice, situated at walking distance from the town center , great internet connection, a metro station in front of the hotel. Also we've dined in the restaurant and it was a 5 star experience.
reviews.title: I woul come back to this hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: A good all-round hotel: Conveniently located close to the Metro and bus stops, 15-20 minutes' walk to Rossio square (accessible yet away from the tourist noise and bustle). Modern decor, efficient service, comfortable room, very clean and quiet (despite facing the main road of Avenida da Liberdade). High-speed internet in the room is free!
reviews.title: Great hotel, great location, wish there was coffee in the rooms though

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast spread is more than adequate - lovely continental spread (the local oranges were beautiful) and selection of Nespresso coffees. Helpful hotel staff with ready advice. I wish there was coffee and tea-making facilities in the room, but this did not detract from the overall quality of the hotel.
reviews.title: A good choice-- but don't ask for a restaurant recommendation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We enjoyed our stay at this hotel. However, we had the worst dinner we have ever experienced in Europe by following the recommendation of one of the front desk staff. I had expected there to be a concierge, and it is the one service the hotel lacked. The restaurant in the hotel was actually very good, and we appreciated being able to get an early dinner the night we arrived suffering major jet lag and wanting to hit the bed early. Our room was very comfortable, with excellent bedding and a good mattress.
reviews.title: Underwhelming but perfectly adequate option

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Marques de Pombal is a funny location, at the wrong end of Avenida de Liberdad for most of Lisbon's things to do, but handy for the metro and the art museums, and the park, and just 15 minutes to walk downtown (or a 5 min, 4 Euro taxi ride). The hotel itself is, well, fine. It claims to be a 4 star, but really you should expect a standard 3 star experience. Clean lobby and friendly staff, if a little inefficient. Our room was small but pleasant, with the vibe of a business hotel. Adequately spacious though, with two armchairs and a little coffee table, as well as a desk. They frustratingly claim to have wifi in all public areas. By this they mean the lobby only. In the room, if you have a laptop, you can plug in for free internet access at the desk, but we found this less convenient than wifi. Rooms cleaned daily, and bathroom pleasant. Breakfast is a mediocre buffet, with the usual cereals/cheese/croissants/bacon and eggs/juice/coffee, which is fine. We'd hoped for better, as this hotel describes itself as a boutique hotel, which it really is not. But it's a good option if you get a good price on the rooms and aren't staying too long.
reviews.title: Fantastic all around
